page.title: 06Brazils Farm
page.content: Mr. Cooper keeps 100 milking cows on his farm, but in Autumn he grazes 36 Herefords. The 106 acres of the farm are split 37 for grass, 36 for wheat and 63 acres for barley. All these crops go towards feeding cattle. The grass is cut for silage. No hay is used on this farm. Some of the barley is put through the dresser for fodder while the rest is sold with the wheat. This is one of the smaller farms we visited and Mr. Cooper is the tenant. In 1944 a V2 rocket destroyed the Essex barn, so another was rebuilt in 1946. Nowadays only 2 people work on the farm. Contractors are hired with their machines to cut the crop and bale the hay. Round bales are preferred today.
